instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 Wont boot all the way
threads.message:
Clean board, wont boot all the way and it gets stuck for ever, ASD shows 5 different memory errors, is this thing done?

I resoldered U8900 with fresh new solder, but same issue.

threads.title: 820-3332 Wont boot all the way
threads.message:
Post the exact error messages you've get.
Did you try to boot in SMC bypass?

threads.title: 820-3332 Wont boot all the way
threads.message: Did not try SMC bypass since it did start fine a couple times, but I can try.

threads.title: 820-3332 Wont boot all the way
threads.message:
RAM problems, or even CPU.
Try  to reflow each RAM chip and gently tap on top of it.

threads.title: 820-3332 Wont boot all the way
threads.message:
Replace ALL RAM chips?
Consider if worth the job...

threads.title: 820-3332 Wont boot all the way
threads.message: 32 RAM chips, Ill skip this one...
